primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human subject must overcome the state of neutrality/noncommitment by actively choosing to commit to God and social justice to prevent being re-occupied by evil.

tekstueel_bewijs: the nation lacks the capacity to commit itself
throw ourselves in on the side of something
sustained, steady commitment to what belongs to God

zender.identificatie: The God of History / The Founders / Moral Conscience
tekstueel_bewijs: destiny to which the God of history had summoned it
find in that offering, true life
a decent respect to the opinions of mankind

helper.identificatie: Orpheus (Christ as a 'lovelier melody') / Inspiration / Historical Documents
tekstueel_bewijs: the soft melodies of Orpheus's harp
the song of Christ... is a lovelier melody
the fallacy of this notion of noncommitment
some stammer, some stutter in our character
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is framed as a 'hesitation' or 'stutter' in character rather than an ontological death requiring resurrection.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The National Program: America must fulfill its founding documents by committing to civil rights.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The United States
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The individual's spiritual commitment is mirrored in and validated by the nation's political commitment.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: a man... may lash himself to the prow

voorbeelden: shows the fallacy of this notion

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It assumes the hearer has the 'Pouvoir' (power) but lacks the 'Vouloir' (will/commitment).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Neutrality) to S2 (Evil) to ~S2 (Self-effort/Ulysses) to S1 (Commitment/Jason).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through the 'lovelier music' of Christ which motivates the human subject to choose S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; evil is a 'horde' but only enters because of human 'emptiness'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While Christ is mentioned, he functions as a 'Helper' (Orpheus) to the human 'Subject' (Jason). The engine of the sermon is the human will's capacity to choose commitment.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We were born for a purpose, to throw ourselves in...
if some worthy purpose does not claim us then some unworthy purpose will claim us.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the music of Christ... is a lovelier melody than the world can ever sing.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jason and Ulysses are used as models for how to navigate life's temptations.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The house is swept by God; Christ is the strong man who binds the demon, not just a better song to listen to.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration followed by the burden of 'steadfast purpose'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where man provides the commitment and God provides the music.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Strongly integrated political and individual narratives, but soteriologically confused.
spanning_punten: Christ is 'Lord' but acts only as a musician (Helper) rather than Savior (Subject).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the music of Christ... is a lovelier melody... herein is our destiny... to offer ourselves.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is replaced by the 'music' of Christ's example.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'hazard' of being 'uncommitted' or 'neutral'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon casts the hearer as the Subject who must fill their own 'empty house' with commitment. God/Christ is relegated to the role of a Helper/Adjuvant.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The human is the subject of 'offering', 'committing', and 'cleansing'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject who occupies the house and keeps the demons out.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We must offer ourselves to God,' use 'Christ has seized us for Himself, so that we are no longer empty.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer as the 'house' which is helpless to defend itself unless Christ dwells within.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on the Spirit's power to sustain commitment where human 'stuttering' fails.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Sin as a 'Strong Man' that only a 'Stronger Man' (Luke 11:21-22) can defeat.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'hesitation', the hearer thinks they can fix it with more effort.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (commitment) is the primary program; Soteriology is secondary/absent.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. Christ commits to us (Soteriology). 2. We are enabled to commit to the neighbor (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The rhetoric is masterful and the social passion is vital, but the 'engine' of the sermon relies on human willpower rather than the finished work of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is a masterpiece of American civil religion; semiotically, it is a law-driven recruitment speech.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of the 'empty house' usually emphasizes the necessity of the Holy Spirit, which is missing here.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'Christ' is a functional 'Helper' (instrument) rather than the 'Subject' (agent) of the salvation described.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Orpheus' myth to create a 'Vouloir-faire' (desire) for Christ, but fails to provide the 'Pouvoir-faire' (power) beyond human resolve.
